td.stdimg: The Products and users page for an administrator.

tr.td: If you are logged in as an administrator you will see that there is an additional box in the lower part of the page.
Useradministration is explained in the section below.
Pressing the Prohibit new logins button will prohibit all new login attempts.
Here you can create, edit and delete users.
To create a new user enter the new userid in the Add new user section and press the Create new userbutton. After this the page with user data appears (see below).
To edit a user press the Edit button in the userlist. After this the page with user data appears (see below). The page will be already filled in with the current user data.

td.stdimg: The useredit page when editing the standard CMS User.

tr.td: This page is for editing user specific data like name, section, phone and password. Additionally you can define the rights a user has to edit different parts of your project(s). This is explained below.

Common rights: These rights are shared among all existing projects. There are two common rights. The first determines if the user has admin role. Admins are allowed to edit anything and can manage all user data. The second determines if the user is allowed to edit the default branch of dynamic includes like statuscodes. The default branch of dynamic includes is used by all projects which do not have a product specific branch of them.

Project specific rights: As the name says a project specific right is only valid for a single project. It consists of a set of three special rights. Every project has such a set of rights.
The first determines if a user is allowed to create and edit include parts for the project. With this right you are also allowed to create and delete product specific branches. If you want to modify an include which is used by another project you must have the 'Edit Includes' right for this project.
The next one determines if a user is allowed to upload images for the project. If you want to change an image which is used by another product you must have the 'Edit Images' right for this product.
The last right determines if you are allowed to create or edit product specific branches of dynamic includes.
Note: The words 'project' and 'product' are used synonymical here.
